subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: Possibly borrowed from the linguistic ancestor of {{cog|hmx-pro|*glaau³ᴬ}} ({{zh-ref|Bodman 1980}}, {{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}). The oldest-known domesticated peach stones so far have been excavated in [https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4156326/ Zhejiang], east of the {{w|Zhongyuan|Central Plain}} cradle of Chinese civilization.
